Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2008 02:45PM CallyAnn wrote: okay, well thank you so much!  I feel kind of silly, i just assumed no one was there on a weekend.  I just called and they are going to have a surgeon call me back.  Thank you!
Posts.Title: Just had surgery, have question CallyAnn CallyAnn

Posts.Content: CallyAnn wrote: I had a lump removed on wednesday afternoon, waiting for biopsy results.  I woke up the first night after the surgery and there was all these little drops of blood I originally thought was from the incision.  Tonight i realized the blood was actually coming out of my nipple.  Im worried now, I don't know if this is normal.  Has anyone ever had this?  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just had surgery, have question CallyAnn CallyAnn

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2008 01:07PM CallyAnn wrote: Honestly, I dont know, someone else will probably be better at answering that than me.  I think it would depend on what they actually see.  3 years ago,  I went with just the ultrasound and they didn't see anything..... next month the lump was gone.  Last month I had a lump that stayed for 3 months and I had a mam. and an ultrasound.  It showed up on both.  I think ultimately you should do what you feel is right, even if it means pushing.
Posts.Title: Worried and waiting mom2girls mom2girls

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2008 12:54PM CallyAnn wrote: Hi Jessica, Im new here to.  I am 32 and also have 2 little girls 4 and 9.  I just wanted to tell you that shortly after i stopped nursing my youngest i had fibrocystic changes.  It started with a few little lumps, and then I had many.  I remember being really scared at the changes, and i had an ultrasound then, which came back normal.  I started doing exams every month before and after my cycle and like Bessie said I only worried if it stayed.  Also, I don't know if this is just a myth or not, but when I cut back on the caffeine i seem to have less lumps.
Posts.Title: Worried and waiting mom2girls mom2girls

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2008 01:37PM CallyAnn wrote: Jessica, Thanks for your support.  You will be in my thoughts also, I hope your time waiting for your appointment will get easier and that everything will be good news for you.  Cally
Posts.Title: Worried and waiting mom2girls mom2girls

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2008 01:19PM CallyAnn wrote: They said the many lumps I had were fibrocystic, but the one that stayed was solid, they also found another one on the mam, that I couldn't feel.  The raidiologist said probably fibroadenoma, so last wednesday I chose to only have the one I could feel taken out and biopsied.  I am still waiting for the results.  I am also worried, I guess thats why im here.  Also, my lumps dont start "changing" again, until about a week after my period.
Posts.Title: Worried and waiting mom2girls mom2girls
